alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 25 at 8:08PM EDT until September 26 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EDT TUESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 11 PM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, there is a high risk of rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Accomack County. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, from 8 AM EDT Tuesday through Tuesday evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 2 PM to 11 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Shallow flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline resulting in a low threat of property damage. Expect up to one foot of water above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks and lawns near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SAXIS VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.0 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 25/10 PM 3.9 1.4 1.1 1-2 NONE 26/10 AM 3.2 0.7 0.7 2 NONE 26/11 PM 4.0 1.5 1.1 2 NONE 27/11 AM 4.5 2.0 1.7 2 MINOR 27/11 PM 4.6 2.1 1.6 2 MINOR 28/12 PM 4.5 2.0 1.5 2 MINOR NASSAWADOX CREEK AT BAYFORD VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 3.0 FT, MODERATE 3.5 FT, MAJOR 4.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.0 FT, MODERATE 1.5 FT, MAJOR 2.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 25/07 PM 2.8 0.8 1.0 2 NONE 26/08 AM 2.8 0.8 1.2 2 NONE 26/08 PM 3.5 1.5 1.7 4 MODERATE 27/09 AM 3.8 1.8 2.0 3 MODERATE 27/10 PM 3.8 1.8 1.9 3 MODERATE 28/10 AM 3.6 1.6 1.7 3 MODERATE CHINCOTEAGUE INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.2 FT, MAJOR 3.2 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 26/06 AM 3.6 0.8 1.1 1-2 NONE 26/06 PM 4.8 2.0 1.5 2 MINOR 27/07 AM 4.4 1.6 1.6 2 NONE 27/07 PM 4.6 1.8 1.3 2 MINOR 28/08 AM 4.2 1.4 1.1 2 NONE WACHAPREAGUE VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 6.5 FT, MODERATE 7.5 FT, MAJOR 8.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 26/06 AM 5.2 0.7 1.0 1 NONE 26/07 PM 7.1 2.6 2.0 1 MINOR 27/07 AM 7.0 2.5 2.4 1 MINOR 27/08 PM 7.3 2.8 2.1 1 MINOR 28/08 AM 6.5 2.0 1.5 1 MINOR &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Shore break occurs when waves break directly on the beach. It is extremely important to protect your head and neck whenever you are in breaking waves by keeping your hands in front of you at all times. Strong longshore currents can sweep swimmers and surfers into rip currents, piers, jetties and other hazardous areas. In many cases, the longshore current is strong enough to prevent swimmers from being able to keep their feet on the bottom making it difficult to return to shore.
